Because CCS always adds cost, policy instruments are required for
Relevant policy instruments include financial instruments such as emission certification
and trading, legally enforced emission restraints, and carbon pricing
. There are some recent examples of policy instruments specifically focused on promoting

Bioenergy has the potential to be a high
scale mitigation option to support many
different parts of the energy system. Bioenergy could be particularly valuable for sectors with limit
alternatives to fossil fuels (e.g., aviation, heavy industry), production of chemicals and products, and,
potentially, in carbon dioxide removal (CDR) via BECCS or biochar. While traditional biomass and
generation biofuels are widely used today, t
and growing dedicated bioenergy crops raises a broad set of
carbon energy systems is therefore uncertain (
his section focuses on the key technological developments for deployment of
Bioenergy is versatile: technology pathways exist to produce multiple energy carriers from biomass
. Different chemical and biological conversion pathways exist to convert diverse
biomass feedstocks into multiple final energy carriers (
to produce heat or for cooking purposes (traditional biomass), electricity, or first
